channel.title: [C4D] Slime animation
channel.description:
My first with fluid, it came out pretty nice until google shoved it up their ass.
Took 20 hours to render, 3 hours to upload.. and here it is... A faster frame rate could have been nicer but it will do.
http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=7673599561058293600&hl=en
Screenshot from the actual high quality uncompressed vid: [img]http://img505.imageshack.us/img505/8392/shot1pf3.png[/img] [img]http://img149.imageshack.us/img149/245/shot2ze4.png[/img]
I really only focused on the quality of the slime because i wanted to make the render time as small as possible.

item.title: [C4D] Slime animation
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Realflow takes a while to render simple things like this, and it was only my first So more particles and a bigger scene wont be to friendly, but ill try. Actually im rendering one right now in RF

Yea they slid across the box like ice…

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Slime animation
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

WOW. That looks EXACTLY like my old one from a longgg ass time ago O_o
just different materials.

Without even watching it I can tell you what’s wrong with it.

This looks like a fairly simple scene. You can totally increase the res. Scale the scene back up in realflow, and increase the particle res.

And then, adjust the friction on the box to make it seem like slime. Right now it’s like… mercury.

Read full topic
